title: Features
description: Features are decorations scattered throughout the world. Things such as trees, plants, flowers, springs, ore, and coral are all features. Basically, if it isn't the terrain or a mob, it's probably a feature!

A.title: Format Version
A.description: A version that tells minecraft what type of data format can be expected when reading this file.

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: The name of this feature in the form `namespace_name:feature_name`. `feature_name` must match the filename.

B.title: Aggregate Feature
B.description:
'minecraft:aggregate_feature` places a collection of features in an arbitary order. All features in the collection use the same input position. Features should not depend on each other, as there is no guarantee on the order the features will be placed.
 Succeeds if: At lease one feature is placed successfully.
 Fails if: All features fail to be placed.

features.title: Features
features.description: Collection of features to be placed one by one. No guarantee of order. All features use the same input position.

items.title: Feature
items.description: Feature identifer

early_out.title: Early Out
early_out.description: Do not continue placing features once either the first success or first failure has occurred.

additionalProperties.title: State Value
additionalProperties.description: The key of property is the name of the block state/property, the value must be the same as the block properties accepted values.

tags.description: A condition using Molang queries that results to true/false that can be used to query for blocks with certain tags.

I.title: Molang Number
I.description: The minecraft molang definition that results in a float.

E.title: Cave Carver Feature
E.description: `minecraft:cave_carver_feature` carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern. This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass `pregeneration_pass`.

fill_with.title: Fill With
fill_with.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

width_modifier.title: Width Modifier
width_modifier.description: How many blocks to increase the cave radius by, from the center point of the cave.

skip_carve_chance.title: Skip Carve Chance
skip_carve_chance.description: The chance to skip doing the carve (1 / value).

height_limit.title: Height Limit
height_limit.description: The height limit where we attempt to carve

J.title: Fossil Feature
J.description: 'minecraft:fossil_feature' generates a skeletal structure composed of bone blocks and parametric ore blocks.

ore_block.title: Ore Block
ore_block.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

BA.title: Geode Feature
BA.description:
`minecraft:geode_feature` generates a rock formation to simulate a geode. Each layer of, and block within, the geode can be replaced.
Succeeds if: At least one block within the geode is placed.
Fails if: All blocks within the geode fail to be placed.

filler.title: Filler
filler.description: The block to fill the inside of the geode.

inner_layer.title: Inner Layer
inner_layer.description: The block that forms the inside layer of the geode shell.

alternate_inner_layer.title: Alternate Inner Layer
alternate_inner_layer.description: The block that has a chance of generating instead of inner_layer.

middle_layer.title: Middle Layer
middle_layer.description: The block that forms the middle layer of the geode shell.

outer_layer.title: Outer Layer
outer_layer.description: The block that forms the outer shell of the geode.

inner_placements.title: Inner Placements
inner_placements.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

items.title: Block Reference
items.description: A block that may be replaced during placement.

min_outer_wall_distance.title: Minimum Outer Wall Distance
min_outer_wall_distance.description: The minimum distance each distribution point must be from the outer wall. [0,10]

max_outer_wall_distance.title: Maximum Outer Wall Distance
max_outer_wall_distance.description: The maximum distance each distribution point can be from the outer wall. [0,20]

min_distribution_points.title: Minimum Distribution Points
min_distribution_points.description: The minimum number of points inside the distance field that can get generated. The distance field is the area consisting of all points with a minimum distance to all destribution points. [0,10]

max_distribution_points.title: Maximum Distribution Points
max_distribution_points.description: The maximum number of points inside the distance field that can get generated. The distance field is the area consisting of all points with a minimum distance to all destribution points. [0,20]

min_point_offset.title: Minimum Point Offset
min_point_offset.description: The lowest possible value of random offset applied to the position of each distribution point. [0,10]

max_point_offset.title: Maximum Point Offset
max_point_offset.description: The highest possible value of random offset applied to the position of each distribution point. [0,10]

max_radius.title: Maximum Radius
max_radius.description: The maximum possible radius of the geode generated.

crack_point_offset.title: Crack Point Offset
crack_point_offset.description: An offset applied to each distribution point that forms the geode crack opening. [0,10]

generate_crack_chance.title: Generate Crack Chance
generate_crack_chance.description: The likelihood of a geode generating with a crack in its shell. [0,1]

base_crack_size.title: Base Crack Size
base_crack_size.description: How large the crack opening of the geode should be when generated. [0,5]

noise_multiplier.title: Noise Multiplier
noise_multiplier.description: A multiplier applied to the noise that is applied to the distribution points within the geode. Higher = more noisy.

use_potential_placements_chance.title: Use Potential Placements Chance
use_potential_placements_chance.description: The likelihood that a special block will be placed on the inside of the geode. [0,1]

use_alternate_layer0_chance.title: Use Alternate Layer0 Chance
use_alternate_layer0_chance.description: The likelihood that a block in the innermost layer of the geode will be replaced with an alternate option. [0,1]

placements_require_layer0_alternate.title: Placements Require Layer0 Alternate
placements_require_layer0_alternate.description: If true, the potential placement block will only be placed on the alternate layer0 blocks that get placed. Potential placement blocks are blocks that depend on the existance of another block to be placed. The latter are the layer0 alternate blocks.

invalid_blocks_threshold.title: Invalid Blocks Threshold
invalid_blocks_threshold.description: The threshold of invalid blocks for a geode to have a distribution point in before it aborts generation entirely.

items.title: Blocks
items.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the plant.

items.title: Plant Body Block
items.description: Plant body block.

items.title: A
items.description: The first value of the range.

items.title: B
items.description: The second value of the range.

range_min.title: Range Min
range_min.description: The minimum value of the range.

range_max.title: Range Max
range_max.description: The maximum value of the range.

BB.title: Growing Plant Feature
BB.description:
`minecraft:growing_plant_feature` places a growing plant in the world. A growing plant is a column that is anchored either to the ceiling or the floor, based on its growth direction.
The growing plant has a body and a head, where the head is the tip of the plant, and the body consists of the remainder blocks.
This feature can be used to define growing plants with variable body and head blocks, e.g. Cave Vines.

age.title: Age
age.description: Age of the head of the plant.

height_distribution.title: Height Distribution
height_distribution.description: Collection of weighted heights that placement will select from.

items.title: Items
items.description: Collection of weighted heights that placement will select from.

items.title: Plant Height
items.description: Plant height.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

growth_direction.title: Growth Direction
growth_direction.description: Direction that the plant grows towards. Valid values: UP and DOWN

body_blocks.title: Body Blocks
body_blocks.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the body of the plant.

head_blocks.title: Head Blocks
head_blocks.description: Collection of weighted block descriptor that placement will select from for the body of the plant.

allow_water.title: Allow Water
allow_water.description: Plant blocks can be placed in water.

BD.title: Multiface Feature
BD.description:
`minecraft:multiface_feature` places one or a few multiface blocks on floors/walls/ceilings. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if this feature can be placed on them based on the list provided in the `can_place_on` field. If no `can_replace_on` field is specified, the `place_block` block can be placed on any existing block.
This feature will also try to spread the `place_block` block around the location in world the feature is placed.
Succeeds if: At least one block is successfully placed.
Fails if: All block placements fail.

places_block.title: Places Block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

search_range.title: Search Range
search_range.description: How far, in blocks, this feature can search for a valid position to place.

can_place_on_floor.title: Can Place On Floor
can_place_on_floor.description: Can this feature be placed on the ground (top face of a block)?.

can_place_on_ceiling.title: Can Place On Ceiling
can_place_on_ceiling.description: Can this feature be placed on the ceiling (bottom face of a block)?.

can_place_on_wall.title: Can Place On Wall
can_place_on_wall.description: Can this feature be placed on the wall (side faces of a block)?.

chance_of_spreading.title: Chance Of Spreading
chance_of_spreading.description: For each block placed by this feature, how likely will that block spread to another?.

can_place_on.title: Can Place On
can_place_on.description: How far, in blocks, this feature can search for a valid position to place.

items.title: Block
items.description: A list of blocks that the block in this feature can be placed on. Omit this field to allow any block to be placed on.

BE.title: Nether Cave Carver Feature
BE.description: `minecraft:nether_cave_carver_feature` carves a cave through the Nether in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass `pregeneration_pass`.

fill_with.title: Identifier
fill_with.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

width_modifier.title: Identifier
width_modifier.description: How many blocks to increase the cave radius by, from the center point of the cave.

skip_carve_chance.title: Skip Carve Chance
skip_carve_chance.description: The chance to skip doing the carve (1 / value).

height_limit.title: Height Limit
height_limit.description: The height limit where we attempt to carve

BF.title: Ore Feature
BF.description:
`minecraft:ore_feature` places a vein of blocks to simulate ore deposits. Despite the name, any block can be placed by this feature. During placement, existing world blocks are checked to see if they can be replaced by the new ore block based on the list provided in the `may_replace` field of a `replace_rules` entry. If no `may_replace` field is specified in a `replace_rule` entry, the ore block can replace any existing block.
Succeeds if: At least one ore block is successfully placed.
Fails if: All ore block placements fail.

count.title: Count
count.description: The number of blocks to be placed.

replace_rules.title: Replace Rules
replace_rules.description: Collection of replace rules that will be checked in order of definition. If a rule is resolved, the rest will not be resolved for that block position.

items.title: Repalce Rule
items.description: If a rule is resolved, the rest will not be resolved for that block position.

places_block.title: Places Block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

may_replace.title: May Replace
may_replace.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

discard_chance_on_air_exposure.title: Discard Chance On Air Exposure
discard_chance_on_air_exposure.description: Chance of discarding placement if neighboring block is Air.

BG.title: Partially Exposed Blob Feature
BG.description: 'minecraft:partially_exposed_blob_feature' generates a blob of the specified block with the specified dimensions For the most part the blob is embedded in the specified surface, however a single side is allowed to be exposed.

places_block.title: Places Block
places_block.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

placement_radius_around_floor.title: Placement Radius Around Floor
placement_radius_around_floor.description: Defines the cubic radius of the blob.

placement_probability_per_valid_position.title: Placement Probability Per Valid Position
placement_probability_per_valid_position.description: The probability of trying to place a block at each position within the placement bounds.

exposed_face.title: Exposed Face
exposed_face.description: Defines a block face that is allowed to be exposed to air and/or water. Other faces need to be embedded for blocks to be placed by this feature. Defaults to upwards face

oneOf.description: Expression for the coordinate (evaluated each iteration). Mutually exclusive with random distribution object below.
Distribution for the coordinate (evaluated each iteration). Mutually exclusive with Molang expression above.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: Type of distribution - uniform random, gaussian (centered in the range),  triangle (centered in the range), or grid (either fixed-step or jittered).

step_size.title: Step Size
step_size.description: When the distribution type is grid, defines the distance between steps along this axis.

grid_offset.title: Step Size
grid_offset.description: When the distribution type is grid, defines the offset along this axis.

extent.title: Extent
extent.description: The lower and upper bound as an offset from the input position

items.title: Lower Bound
items.description: Lower bound (inclusive) of the scatter range, as an offset from the input point to scatter around.

items.title: Upper Bound
items.description: Upper bound (inclusive) of the scatter range, as an offset from the input point to scatter around.

BH.title: Scatter Feature
BH.description:
`minecraft:scatter_feature` scatters a feature throughout a chunk. The `x`, `y`, and `z` fields are per-coordinate parameters.
Note that coordinates represent an offset from the input position, not an absolute position. Coordinates may be a single value, a random distribution, or molang expression that resolves to a numeric value. The `coordinate_eval_order` field is provided for finer control of coordinate resolution (particularly when using the `grid` distribution). `iterations` controls how many individual placements should occur if the `scatter_chance` check succeeds. The `scatter_chance` check happens once, so either all placements will run or none will.
Succeeds if: At least one feature placement succeeds.
Fails if: All feature placements fail.

places_feature.title: Places Feature
places_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed.

project_input_to_floor.title: Project Input To Floor
project_input_to_floor.description: If true, snaps the y-value of the scattered position to the terrain heightmap. If false or unset, y-value is unmodified.

distribution.title: Distribution
distribution.description: Parameters controlling the initial scatter of the feature.

coordinate_eval_order.title: Coordinate Eval Order
coordinate_eval_order.description: The order in which coordinates will be evaluated. Should be used when a coordinate depends on another. If omitted, defaults to `xzy`.

iterations.title: Iterations
iterations.description: Number of scattered positions to generate.

oneOf.description: Probability (0-100] that this scatter will occur.  Not evaluated each iteration; either no iterations will run, or all will.
Probability numerator / denominator that this scatter will occur.  Not evaluated each iteration; either no iterations will run, or all will.

BI.title: Search Feature
BI.description:
`minecraft:search_feature` sweeps a volume searching for a valid placement location for its referenced feature. The `search_volume` field specifies the axis-aligned bounding box that defines the boundaries of the search. The search sweeps along the axis defined by the `search_axis` field, layer by layer. For example, if `search_axis` = '-x', blocks with greater x values will be checked before blocks with lower x values. Each layer is searched from the bottom-left to the top-right before moving to the next layer along the axis. By default, only one valid position must be found, but this can be altered by specifying the `required_successes` field. If fewer than the required successes are found, no placement will occur.
Succeeds if: The number of valid positions is equal to the value specified by `required_successes`.
Fails if: The number of valid positions is less than the value specified by `required_successes`.

places_feature.title: Places Feature
places_feature.description: Named reference of feature to be placed.

search_volume.title: Places Feature
search_volume.description: Axis-aligned bounding box that will be searched for valid placement positions. Expressed as offsets from the input position.

max.title: Max
max.description: Maximum extent of the bounding volume expressed as [ x, y, z ].

min.title: Min
min.description: Maxium extent of the bounding volume expressed as [ x, y, z ].

search_axis.title: Search Axis
search_axis.description: Axis that the search will sweep along through the `search_volume`.

required_successes.title: Required Successes
required_successes.description: Number of valid positions the search must find in order to place the referenced feature.

BJ.title: Sequence Feature
BJ.description:
`minecraft:sequence_feature` places a collection of features sequentially, in the order they appear in data. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position for the next. For example, a tree feature is placed at (0, 0, 0) and places blocks up to (0, 10, 0). The next feature in the sequence begins at (0, 10, 0).
Succeeds if: All features in the sequence are successfully placed.
Fails if: Any feature in the sequence fails to be placed. Features that have not yet been placed at the time of failure are skipped.

features.title: Features
features.description: List of features to be placed in sequence. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position to the next.

items.title: Feature
items.description: A feature to be placed in sequence. The output position of the previous feature is used as the input position to the next.

oneOf.title: Block
oneOf.description: Reference to the block it may attach to.

items.title: Block
items.description: Reference to the block it may attach to.

CA.title: Single Block Feature
CA.description:
`minecraft:single_block_feature` places a single block in the world. The `may_place_on` and `may_replace` fields are allowlists which specify where the block can be placed. If these fields are omitted, the block can be placed anywhere. The block's internal survivability and placement rules can optionally be enforced with the `enforce_survivability_rules` and `enforce_placement_rules` fields. These rules are specified per-block and are typically designed to produce high quality gameplay or natural behavior. However, enabling this enforcement may make it harder to debug placement failures.
 Succeeds if: The block is successfully placed in the world.
 Fails if: The block fails to be placed.

anyOf.title: Places Block
anyOf.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

anyOf.title: Places Block
anyOf.description: Collection of weighted block references that will be placed.

items.title: Block
items.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

items.title: Block
items.description: Reference to the block to be placed.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Random weight of this block. A higher number will increase the probability of this block to be picked during placement.

enforce_placement_rules.title: Enforce Placement Rules
enforce_placement_rules.description: If true, enforce the block's canPlace check.

enforce_survivability_rules.title: Enforce Survivability Rules
enforce_survivability_rules.description: If true, enforce the block's canSurvive check.

randomize_rotation.title: Randomize Rotation
randomize_rotation.description: If true, randomizes the block's cardinal orientation.

may_attach_to.title: May Attach To
may_attach_to.description: The list of valid block and block faces the given block may attach to when being placed.

min_sides_must_attach.title: Minimum Sides Must Attach
min_sides_must_attach.description: Minimum number of sides that must be attached when being placed.

auto_rotate.title: Auto Rotate
auto_rotate.description: Automatically rotate the block to attach sensibly.

may_not_attach_to.title: May Not Attach To
may_not_attach_to.description: Denylist which specifies where the block can't be placed.

may_replace.title: May Replace
may_replace.description: A list of blocks that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

items.title: Block
items.description: A block that may be replaced during placement. Omit this field to allow any block to be replaced.

CB.title: Snap To Surface Feature
CB.description:
`minecraft:snap_to_surface_feature` snaps the y-value of a feature placement pos to the floor or the ceiling within the provided `vertical_search_range`. The placement biome is preserved. 
If the snap position goes outside of the placement biome, placement will fail.

feature_to_snap.title: Feature To Snap
feature_to_snap.description: Named reference of feature to be snapped.

vertical_search_range.title: Vertical Search Range
vertical_search_range.description: Range to search for a floor or ceiling for snaping the feature.

surface.title: Surface
surface.description: Defines the surface that the y-value of the placement position will be snapped to. Valid values: `ceiling` and `floor'

allow_air_placement.title: Allow Air Placement
allow_air_placement.description: Determines whether the feature can snap through air blocks

allow_underwater_placement.title: Allow Underwater Placement
allow_underwater_placement.description: Determines whether the feature can snap through water blocks

CC.title: Structure Template Feature
CC.description:
`minecraft:structure_template_feature` places a structure in the world. The structure must be stored as a .mcstructure file in the `structures` subdirectory of a behavior pack. It is possible to reference structures that are part of other behavior packs, they do not need to come from the same behavior pack as this feature. Constraints can be defined to specify where the structure is allowed to be placed. During placement, the feature will search for a position within the 'adjustment_radius' that satisfies all constraints. If none are found, the structure will not be placed.
Succeeds if: The structure is placed in the world.
Fails if: The structure fails to be placed within the world.

structure_name.title: Structure Name
structure_name.description: Reference to the structure to be placed.

adjustment_radius.title: Adjustment Radius
adjustment_radius.description: How far the structure is allowed to move when searching for a valid placement position. Search is radial, stopping when the nearest valid position is found. Defaults to 0 if omitted.

facing_direction.title: Facing Direction
facing_direction.description: Direction the structure will face when placed in the world. Defaults to `random` if omitted.

constraints.description: Specific constraints that must be satisfied when placing this structure.

grounded.title: Grounded
grounded.description: When specified, ensures the structure is on the ground.

unburied.title: Unburied
unburied.description: When specified, ensures the structure has air above it.

block_intersection.title: Unburied
block_intersection.description: When specified, ensures the structure has air above it.

block_allowlist.title: Block Allowlist
block_allowlist.description: List of blocks the owning structure is allowed to intersect with.

block_whitelist.title: Block Whitelist
block_whitelist.description: List of blocks the owning structure is allowed to intersect with.

CD.title: Surface Relative Threshold Feature
CD.description: 'minecraft:surface_relative_threshold_feature' determines whether the provided position is below the estimated surface level of the world, and places a feature if so.If the provided position is above configured surface or the surface is not available, placement will fail.

feature_to_place.title: Feature To Place
feature_to_place.description: Named reference of feature to be placed.

minimum_distance_below_surface.title: Minimum Distance Below Surface
minimum_distance_below_surface.description: The minimum number of blocks required to be between the estimated surface level and a valid place for this feature.

acacia_canopy.title: Acacia Canopy
acacia_canopy.description: Configuration object for the acacia canopy.

canopy.title: Canopy
canopy.description: Configuration object for the normal canopy.

canopy_offset.title: Canopy Offset
canopy_offset.description: Canopy position offset relative to the block above the trunk.

canopy_slope.title: Canopy Slope
canopy_slope.description: Configuration object for the canopy slope.

rise.title: Rise
rise.description: The numerator for the slope fraction.

run.title: Run
run.description: The denominator for the slope fraction.

variation_chance.title: Variation Chance
variation_chance.description: Determines the chance of creating leaf blocks for every layer of the canopy. Larger numbers create a denser tree.

canopy_decoration.title: Canopy Decoration
canopy_decoration.description: Configuration object for the canopy decoration.

decoration_block.title: Decoration Block
decoration_block.description: The block used for decorating the trunk.

num_steps.title: Num Steps
num_steps.description: Number of decoration blocks to place.

cherry_canopy.title: Cherry Canopy
cherry_canopy.description: Configuration object for the cherry canopy.

wide_bottom_layer_hole_chance.title: Wide Bottom Layer Hole Chance
wide_bottom_layer_hole_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having a hole in the bottom layer.

corner_hole_chance.title: Corner Hole Chance
corner_hole_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having a hole in the corner.

hanging_leaves_chance.title: Hanging Leaves Chance
hanging_leaves_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having hanging leaves

hanging_leaves_extension_chance.title: Hanging Leaves Extension Chance
hanging_leaves_extension_chance.description: Probability of hanging leaves extending further down

fancy_canopy.title: Fancy Canopy
fancy_canopy.description: Configuration object for the fancy canopy.

mangrove_canopy.title: Mangrove Canopy
mangrove_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mangrove canopy.

leaf_placement_attempts.title: Leaf Placement Attempts
leaf_placement_attempts.description: Max number of attempts to create leaf blocks.

leaf_blocks.title: Leaf Blocks
leaf_blocks.description: The blocks that form the canopy of the tree

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

hanging_block.title: Hanging Block
hanging_block.description: The block to be used as a hanging block.

hanging_block_placement_chance.title: Hanging Block Placement Chance
hanging_block_placement_chance.description: Probability of creating a hanging leaf block.

mega_canopy.title: Mega Canopy
mega_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mega canopy.

mega_pine_canopy.title: Mega Pine Canopy
mega_pine_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mega pine canopy.

radius_step_modifier.title: Radius Step Modifier
radius_step_modifier.description: Modifier for the base radius of the canopy.

pine_canopy.title: Pine Canopy
pine_canopy.description: Configuration object for the pine canopy.

roofed_canopy.title: Roofed Canopy
roofed_canopy.description: Configuration object for the roofed canopy.

canopy_height.title: Canopy Height
canopy_height.description: Roofed canopies feature a base and a top layer, and an extra cap layer on some occasions, this value controls the number of layers in the middle.

outer_radius.title: Outer Radius
outer_radius.description: Radius used for the base and top layers.

inner_radius.title: Inner Radius
inner_radius.description: Radius used for the middle layers.

spruce_canopy.title: Spruce Canopy
spruce_canopy.description: Configuration object for the spruce canopy.

CE_leaf_block.title: Leaf Block
CE_leaf_block.description: The block thata forms the canopy of the tree.

CE_trunk_width.title: Trunk Width
CE_trunk_width.description: The width of the tree trunk.

CE_height.title: Height
CE_height.description: Number of layers for the canopy.

decoration_block.title: Decoration Block
decoration_block.description: The block used for decorating the trunk.

num_steps.title: Num Steps
num_steps.description: Number of decoration blocks to place.

CE_simplify_canopy.title: Simplify Canopy
CE_simplify_canopy.description: If true the canopy uses a simple pattern.

CE_trunk_block.title: Trunk Block
CE_trunk_block.description: The block that forms the tree trunk.

CF.title: Chance Information
CF.description: Chance of something happening represented either as a fraction or a percentage.

CE.title: Tree Feature
CE.description: 'minecraft:tree_feature' will place a tree in the world. A tree consists of a column that is anchored to a base block with set parameters for what it can be placed on and canopy that extends from the column. Trees support multiple types of canopies, trunks, and roots.

base_cluster.title: Base Cluster
base_cluster.description: Allows you to define a number of clusters for the base of the tree. Used to generate mega tree variants.

may_replace.title: May Replace
may_replace.description: List of blocks that the base cluster of a tree can replace.

num_clusters.title: Num Clusters
num_clusters.description: Number of clusters that can be generated.

cluster_radius.title: Clusters Radius
cluster_radius.description: Radius where the clusters that can be generated.

may_grow_on.title: May Grow On
may_grow_on.description: List of blocks where a tree can grow on.

may_replace.title: May Reaplce
may_replace.description: List of blocks that a tree can replace.

may_grow_through.title: May Grow Through
may_grow_through.description: List of blocks that a tree can grow through.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Configuration object for the trunk height.

intervals.title: Intervals
intervals.description: Intervals used to randomize the trunk height, the value of each interval will create a random number where (0 <= rand < interval)), and will be added to the height.

min_height_for_canopy.title: Minimum Height For Canopy
min_height_for_canopy.description: Min height where the canopy can be placed.

allow_diagonal_growth.title: Allow Diagonal Growth
allow_diagonal_growth.description: If true, diagonal branches will be created.

lean_height.title: Lean Height
lean_height.description: Number of blocks below the tree height at which diagonal branches can be created.

lean_steps.title: Lean Steps
lean_steps.description: Number of steps taken in X/Z direction while creating a diagonal branch.

lean_length.title: Lean Length
lean_length.description: Length for the diagonal branch in the Y axis.

branch_length.title: Branch Length
branch_length.description: Length for the branch in the Y axis.

branch_position.title: Branch Position
branch_position.description: Starting Y position for the branch.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Configuration object for the trunk height.

intervals.title: Intervals
intervals.description: Intervals used to randomize the trunk height, the value of each interval will create a random number where (0 <= rand < interval)), and will be added to the height.

tree_type_weights.title: Tree Type Weights
tree_type_weights.description: Configuration object to pick a tree variant based on a weighted random number

branch_start_offset_from_top.title: Branch Start Offset From Top
branch_start_offset_from_top.description: Branch starting position relative to the top of the tree

branch_end_offset_from_top.title: Branch End Offset From Top
branch_end_offset_from_top.description: Branch end position relative to the top of the tree

height_modifier.title: Height Modifier
height_modifier.description: Modifier for the length of the fallen log.

log_decoration_feature.title: Log Decoration Feature
log_decoration_feature.description: Feature that can be used to decorate the fallen log.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Configuration object for the trunk height.

scale.title: Scale
scale.description: Final tree height is multiplied by this scale.

slope.title: Slope
slope.description: Slope for the branch, where 0 is horizontal and 1 is vertical.

min_altitude_factor.title: Min Altitude Factor
min_altitude_factor.description: Min height for branches. Represented by a percentage of the tree height.

width_scale.title: Width Scale
width_scale.description: Scale modifier for the tree radius.

foliage_altitude_factor.title: Foliage Altitude Factor
foliage_altitude_factor.description: Min height for foliage. Represented by a percentage of the tree height.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Configuration object for the trunk height.

branch_length.title: Branch Length
branch_length.description: Length for the branch in the Y axis.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Configuration object for the trunk height.

intervals.title: Intervals
intervals.description: Intervals used to randomize the trunk height, the value of each interval will create a random number where (0 <= rand < interval)), and will be added to the height.

min_height_for_canopy.title: Minimum Height For Canopy
min_height_for_canopy.description: Min height where the canopy can be placed.

branch_slope.title: Branch Slope
branch_slope.description: Slope for the branch, where 0 is horizontal and 1 is vertical.

branch_altitude_factor.title: Branch Altitude Factor
branch_altitude_factor.description: Altitude at which branches can spawn, relative to the tree height.

min.title: Min
min.description: Min altitude where branches can spawn.

max.title: Max
max.description: Max altitude where branches can spawn.

trunk_height.title: Trunk Height
trunk_height.description: Defines the height of the trunk.

height_modifier.title: Height Modifier
height_modifier.description: Modifier for the height of the trunk.

can_be_submerged.title: Can Be Submerged
can_be_submerged.description: Specifies if the trunk can be submerged.

max_depth.title: Max Depth
max_depth.description: Defines the max depth at which the trunk can be submerged.

acacia_canopy.title: Acacia Canopy
acacia_canopy.description: Configuration object for the acacia canopy.

canopy.title: Canopy
canopy.description: Configuration object for the normal canopy.

canopy_offset.title: Canopy Offset
canopy_offset.description: Canopy position offset relative to the block above the trunk.

canopy_slope.title: Canopy Slope
canopy_slope.description: Configuration object for the canopy slope.

rise.title: Rise
rise.description: The numerator for the slope fraction.

run.title: Run
run.description: The denominator for the slope fraction.

variation_chance.title: Variation Chance
variation_chance.description: Determines the chance of creating leaf blocks for every layer of the canopy. Larger numbers create a denser tree.

canopy_decoration.title: Canopy Decoration
canopy_decoration.description: Configuration object for the canopy decoration.

decoration_block.title: Decoration Block
decoration_block.description: The block used for decorating the trunk.

num_steps.title: Num Steps
num_steps.description: Number of decoration blocks to place.

cherry_canopy.title: Cherry Canopy
cherry_canopy.description: Configuration object for the cherry canopy.

wide_bottom_layer_hole_chance.title: Wide Bottom Layer Hole Chance
wide_bottom_layer_hole_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having a hole in the bottom layer.

corner_hole_chance.title: Corner Hole Chance
corner_hole_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having a hole in the corner.

hanging_leaves_chance.title: Hanging Leaves Chance
hanging_leaves_chance.description: Probability of the canopy having hanging leaves

hanging_leaves_extension_chance.title: Hanging Leaves Extension Chance
hanging_leaves_extension_chance.description: Probability of hanging leaves extending further down

fancy_canopy.title: Fancy Canopy
fancy_canopy.description: Configuration object for the fancy canopy.

mangrove_canopy.title: Mangrove Canopy
mangrove_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mangrove canopy.

leaf_placement_attempts.title: Leaf Placement Attempts
leaf_placement_attempts.description: Max number of attempts to create leaf blocks.

leaf_blocks.title: Leaf Blocks
leaf_blocks.description: The blocks that form the canopy of the tree

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

hanging_block.title: Hanging Block
hanging_block.description: The block to be used as a hanging block.

hanging_block_placement_chance.title: Hanging Block Placement Chance
hanging_block_placement_chance.description: Probability of creating a hanging leaf block.

mega_canopy.title: Mega Canopy
mega_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mega canopy.

mega_pine_canopy.title: Mega Pine Canopy
mega_pine_canopy.description: Configuration object for the mega pine canopy.

radius_step_modifier.title: Radius Step Modifier
radius_step_modifier.description: Modifier for the base radius of the canopy.

pine_canopy.title: Pine Canopy
pine_canopy.description: Configuration object for the pine canopy.

roofed_canopy.title: Roofed Canopy
roofed_canopy.description: Configuration object for the roofed canopy.

canopy_height.title: Canopy Height
canopy_height.description: Roofed canopies feature a base and a top layer, and an extra cap layer on some occasions, this value controls the number of layers in the middle.

outer_radius.title: Outer Radius
outer_radius.description: Radius used for the base and top layers.

inner_radius.title: Inner Radius
inner_radius.description: Radius used for the middle layers.

spruce_canopy.title: Spruce Canopy
spruce_canopy.description: Configuration object for the spruce canopy.

random_spread_canopy.title: Random Spread Canopy
random_spread_canopy.description: Configuration object for the random spread canopy.

leaf_placement_attempts.title: Leaf Placement Attempts
leaf_placement_attempts.description: Max number of attempts to create leaf blocks.

leaf_blocks.title: Leaf Blocks
leaf_blocks.description: The blocks that form the canopy of the tree

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.

max_root_width.title: Max Root Width
max_root_width.description: Max width that the roots can occupy. The width increases up to the max width while moving downwards. When a max width is reached, roots will grow vertically

max_root_length.title: Max Root Length
max_root_length.description: Max length that the roots can occupy.

above_root.title: Above Root
above_root.description: Configuration object for blocks decorating the top of the roots

above_root_chance.title: Above Root Chance
above_root_chance.description: Probability of creating a block above the root

above_root_block.title: Above Root Block
above_root_block.description: The block placed on the top of the roots.

muddy_root_block.title: Muddy Root Block
muddy_root_block.description: The block used for muddy roots.

mud_block.title: Mud Block
mud_block.description: The block used to determine if a muddy root should be placed.

roots_may_grow_through.title: Roots May Grow Through
roots_may_grow_through.description: List of blocks that a root can grow through.

CG.title: Underwater Cave Carver Feature
CG.description:
'minecraft:underwater_cave_carver_feature' carves a cave through the world in the current chunk, and in every chunk around the current chunk in an 8 radial pattern.This feature will specifically target creating caves only below sea level.
This feature will also only work when placed specifically in the pass `pregeneration_pass`.

fill_with.title: Fill With
fill_with.description: Reference to the block to fill the cave with.

width_modifier.title: Width Modifier
width_modifier.description: How many blocks to increase the cave radius by, from the center point of the cave.

skip_carve_chance.title: Skip Carve Chance
skip_carve_chance.description: The chance to skip doing the carve (1 / value).

height_limit.title: Height Limit
height_limit.description: The height limit where we attempt to carve

replace_air_with.title: Replace Air With
replace_air_with.description: Reference to the block to replace air blocks with.

CH.title: Vegetation Patch Feature
CH.description: Feature type `minecraft:vegetation_patch_feature` has not yet been documented.

replaceable_blocks.title: Replaceable Blocks
replaceable_blocks.description: Blocks that can be replaced by the ground blocks on the patch.

ground_block.title: Ground Block
ground_block.description: Block used to create a base for the vegetation patch.

vegetation_feature.title: Vegetation Feature
vegetation_feature.description: Feature that will be placed by the patch.

surface.title: Surface
surface.description: Determines if a vegetation patch will grow from the ceiling or the floor.

depth.title: Depth
depth.description: Depth of the base covered by the ground blocks.

extra_deep_block_chance.title: Extra Deep Block Chance
extra_deep_block_chance.description: Probability of putting the ground blocks one block deeper. Adds some randomness to the bottom of the patch.

vertical_range.title: Vertical Range
vertical_range.description: Vertical range used to determine a suitable surface position for the patch.

vegetation_chance.title: Vegatation Chance
vegetation_chance.description: Probability of spawning vegetation on the patch. Larger numbers create a denser vegetation patch.

horizontal_radius.title: Horizontal Radius
horizontal_radius.description: Horizontal area that the vegetation patch will cover.

extra_edge_column_chance.title: Extra Egde Column Chance
extra_edge_column_chance.description: Probability of spawning vegetation on the edge of the patch radius.

waterlogged.title: Waterlogged
waterlogged.description: If true, waterlogs the positions occupied by the ground blocks.

CI.title: Weighted Random Feature
CI.description:
'minecraft:weighted_random_feature' randomly selects and places a feature based on a weight value. Weights are relative, with higher values making selection more likely.
Succeeds if: The selected feature is placed.
Fails if: The selected feature fails to be placed.

features.title: Features
features.description: Collection of weighted features that placement will select from.

items.title: Feature
items.description: Named reference to a feature.

items.title: Feature
items.description: Named reference to a feature.

items.title: Weight
items.description: Weight used in random selection. Value is relative to other weights in the collection.
